text: What's the best way to set up a content library for your sales and customer success team to access an archive of posts, videos, and webinars that are relevant to customers' FAQs. I want it to be easy to access and live where the teams already get essential information like slack. My company is a team of 35 and we don't have an intranet. Would a Google doc suffice? Maybe a page on our website? Open to ideas that work for your teams. I would hate to build it out and not have anyone ever look at it.

elements.text: What's the best way to set up a content library for your sales and customer success team to access an archive of posts, videos, and webinars that are relevant to customers' FAQs. I want it to be easy to access and live where the teams already get essential information like slack. My company is a team of 35 and we don't have an intranet. Would a Google doc suffice? Maybe a page on our website? Open to ideas that work for your teams. I would hate to build it out and not have anyone ever look at it.

text: I would recommend a Google Sheet that is sortable by topic, type, use cases, product, customer lifecycle stage, etc.

elements.text: I would recommend a Google Sheet that is sortable by topic, type, use cases, product, customer lifecycle stage, etc.

text:
We use a specific shared Google Drive as a resources/collateral folder, because that’s our company-wide document/file storage solution. 

Setting it up as the source of truth was easy... convincing people in the company to actually honor that and stop going rogue with their own materials has been much more difficult. :upside_down_face:

We also found it helpful to include a section of our internal monthly newsletter where we showcase all the materials added in the last month and their exact location in the drive. Bigger updates get their own email in real time, in addition to their inclusion in the newsletter.

elements.text:

We also found it helpful to include a section of our internal monthly newsletter where we showcase all the materials added in the last month and their exact location in the drive. Bigger updates get their own email in real time, in addition to their inclusion in the newsletter.

text: Yeah we have multiple places for people to find things and they still act like it's impossible to access the information sometimes. :woman-shrugging::skin-tone-2:

elements.text: Yeah we have multiple places for people to find things and they still act like it's impossible to access the information sometimes.

text: Earlier this week I sent out a new customer video via email, Slack, weekly internal marketing newsletter, put it in the content inventory, and on our website...and people were still asking me where to find it.

text: Pricing check: a potential clients wants a 3-month content strategy with keyword research (topics and outlines) for about 12-15 posts per month. I just do the strategy and the client finds the writer to execute it. Client is in the SaaS industry and bootstrapped. I have a few years of experience in this area but I’ve only done such things in-house and never freelance. What would you charge for this?

elements.text: Pricing check: a potential clients wants a 3-month content strategy with keyword research (topics and outlines) for about 12-15 posts per month. I just do the strategy and the client finds the writer to execute it. Client is in the SaaS industry and bootstrapped. I have a few years of experience in this area but I’ve only done such things in-house and never freelance. What would you charge for this?

text: Following

elements.text: Following

text:
This is work that would probably be done by a senior content strategist. You could assume a bootstrapped company in the US would be paying this person somewhere in the vicinity of $90k/year + another 30% to cover benefits, etc.

That's about ~8k/month. Obviously that person would be doing more work than just this one project, but you can start to see a frame around the value you're creating.

Depending on your experience level, current workload, how much this client will add to your portfolio, etc. etc. you could probably charge somewhere from $5k-15k for this work.

This is all extremely crude math :slightly_smiling_face: and really just one way to think about it.

user_profile.real_name: Janessa Lantz, VP of Marketing at dbt Labs
user_profile.name: janessalantz
